October 15-16, 2015, Lake Buena Vista, FL

The Future is Now for Women:
Transformational Leadership, STEM*, and Inclusion as a Cultural Competence*(Science, Technology, Engineering, Math)







The Speakers

Authors, Talent and Diversity Thought Leaders

Kim Admire

President, Diversity & Inclusion, Previously at Lockheed Martin Corporation

Kim Admire

President, Diversity & Inclusion, Previously at Lockheed Martin Corporation

Kimberly (Kim) Admire is Vice President, Diversity, Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Programs for Lockheed Martin Corporation. In this role, Ms. Admire is responsible for the workforce engagement and compliance strategy for the corporation’s 123,000 employees worldwide.

Simon T. Bailey

Founder, Brilliance Institute

Simon T. Bailey

Founder, Brilliance Institute

Simon T. Bailey is a Leadership Catalyst who aspires to inspire 10% of the world’s population to find their passion and release their brilliance.

Rodney D. Bennett

President, The University of Southern Mississippi

Rodney D. Bennett

President, The University of Southern Mississippi

Dr. Bennett is charged with serving as both the chief executive officer and principal educational officer of The University of Southern Mississippi

Audra Bohannon

Senior Partner, Korn/Ferry International

Audra Bohannon

Senior Partner, Korn/Ferry International

Audra Bohannon is a Senior Partner in the Diversity, Inclusion and Talent Optimization practice for Korn/Ferry International, based in the Boston office. “Lead life by design, not by default” is the message that audiences take away from a presentation led by Ms. Bohannon.

Ruth Bond

Vice President, Global Diversity & Inclusion, The Walt Disney Company

Ruth Bond

Vice President, Global Diversity & Inclusion, The Walt Disney Company

Ruth Bond is Vice President, Global Diversity & Inclusion, The Walt Disney Company.

Candi Castleberry-Singleton

Chief Diversity Officer, University of Pittsburgh Medical Center

Candi Castleberry-Singleton

Chief Diversity Officer, University of Pittsburgh Medical Center

Candi Castleberry Singleton is the Chief Inclusion and Diversity Officer at UPMC, an $11 billion, 21-hospital global health enterprise.

Tena Clark

Founder, Grammy Award recipient, DMI Music & Entertainment

Tena Clark

Founder, Grammy Award recipient, DMI Music & Entertainment

Tena Clark's company program's the President's music for Air Force One and produced Aretha Franklin's most recent album.

Lois Cooper

Vice President, Corporate Development & Inclusion, Adecco Group North America

Lois Cooper

Vice President, Corporate Development & Inclusion, Adecco Group North America

As Vice President, Corporate Development and Inclusion for Adecco Group, Lois Cooper is responsible for developing strategic partnerships and initiatives that support the organization’s business strategies and positively impact the bottom line.

Meredith Crosby

Director, Strategic Initiatives, 3M

Meredith Crosby

Director, Strategic Initiatives, 3M

Meredith Moore Crosby is the Director of Strategic Initiatives for 3Mgives. In this role, Meredith is responsible for the development and implementation of 3M’s strategy to create a deeper pipeline of high performing and diverse global talent through investments in education.

Deborah Dagit

President, Deb Dagit Diversity

Deborah Dagit

President, Deb Dagit Diversity

Deborah Dagit joined Merck as their Chief Diversity Officer in June 2001. She has had responsibility for global equal opportunity, employee relations, recruiting and staffing and diversity & inclusion and has now transitioned to lead Deb Dagit Diversity, a consulting firm that offers practical just-in-time resources, tools and support for diversity practitioners.

Dr. Shirley Davis

President & CEO, SDS Global Enterprises, former VP of Global Diversity & Inclusion, SHRM

Dr. Shirley Davis

President & CEO, SDS Global Enterprises, former VP of Global Diversity & Inclusion, SHRM

Dr. Shirley Davis, SPHR, is an accomplished corporate executive, global workforce and talent management expert, an international speaker, executive coach, and author.

Shinder Dhillon

Global Diversity & Inclusion lead for Sales Marketing & Services Group, Microsoft

Shinder Dhillon

Global Diversity & Inclusion lead for Sales Marketing & Services Group, Microsoft

Shinder Dhillon is the Global Diversity & Inclusion lead for Sales Marketing & Services Group (SMSG) for Microsoft Corporation.

Lourdes Diaz

Vice President of Diversity Relations, Sodexo USA

Lourdes Diaz

Vice President of Diversity Relations, Sodexo USA

Lourdes Diaz is Vice President of Diversity Relations for Sodexo USA, where she is responsible for establishing strategic partnerships with diverse organizations, minority owned businesses and community leaders in key markets around the country.

Melissa B. Donaldson

Director, Diversity Networks & Communications, Walgreen Co.

Melissa B. Donaldson

Director, Diversity Networks & Communications, Walgreen Co.

Melissa is responsible for the inclusion leadership councils, business resource groups, strategic partnerships and diversity communications.

Latoria J. Farmer

Executive Director Of Diversity And Corporate Responsibility, KPMG

Latoria J. Farmer

Executive Director Of Diversity And Corporate Responsibility, KPMG

Latoria J. Farmer is the executive director of diversity and corporate responsibility for KPMG LLP, the U.S. audit, tax, and advisory services firm.

Edie Fraser

CEO, STEMConnector

Edie Fraser

CEO, STEMConnector

Edie Fraser is CEO of STEMconnector™ and Senior Consultant to Diversified Search.

Nancy Gidusko

Director, Corporate Citizenship, Walt Disney World Resort

Nancy Gidusko

Director, Corporate Citizenship, Walt Disney World Resort

Nancy leads the philanthropic community outreach for the Walt Disney World Resort which includes charitable donations, community programs, employee fundraising campaigns and volunteerism.

Jackie Glenn

VP, Global Chief Diversity Officer, EMC

Jackie Glenn

VP, Global Chief Diversity Officer, EMC

Jackie Glenn is a seasoned executive in Strategic Planning, Human Resources, Talent Development, and Diversity and Inclusion. She is currently the VP, Global Chief Diversity Officer for EMC Corporation.

Millette Granville

Millette Granville, Director, Diversity & Inclusion, Delhaize America

Millette Granville

Millette Granville, Director, Diversity & Inclusion, Delhaize America

Millette Granville is the Director of Diversity and Inclusion for Delhaize America.

Carolyn L. Green

President and CEO of Professional Environmental Engineers

Carolyn L. Green

President and CEO of Professional Environmental Engineers

Carolyn L. Green is President and CEO of Professional Environmental Engineers, Inc. (PEEl), a St. Louis-based company providing environmental compliance and remediation services.

Patricia Harris

Global Chief Diversity Officer & VP, Global Community Engagement

Patricia Harris

Global Chief Diversity Officer & VP, Global Community Engagement

Pat is responsible for the development and implementation of diversity and Inclusion strategies throughout McDonald’s Corporation, including the over 33,500 restaurants in 120 countries

Glenda A. Hatchett

Founder and CEO, Great Day Productions

Glenda A. Hatchett

Founder and CEO, Great Day Productions

Hatchett is the Founder and CEO of the newly established production company, Great Day Productions that specializes in television programming.

Peggy Hazard

Managing Principal, Korn Ferry International

Peggy Hazard

Managing Principal, Korn Ferry International

Peggy Hazard specializes in strategic consulting, executive team facilitation, and coaching to help leaders achieve business results through improved Global Leadership, Cultural Dexterity, and Advancing Women Worldwide.

Dr. Gloria Bozeman Herndon

Founder, President & CEO of GB Group Global

Dr. Gloria Bozeman Herndon

Founder, President & CEO of GB Group Global

Dr. Gloria Bozeman Herndon, Founder, President & CEO of GB Group Global, has more than 35 years of successfully conducting business internationally.

Rosalind Hudnell

Vice President of Human Resources & Director of Global Employee Communications & External Relations, Intel Corporation

Rosalind Hudnell

Vice President of Human Resources & Director of Global Employee Communications & External Relations, Intel Corporation

Rosalind L. Hudnell is a Vice President of Human Resources at Intel Corporation and serves as Director of Global Employee Communications and External Relations. Since joining Intel in 1996, Hudnell has held various management positions in community relations, government relations, charitable contributions, media outreach, employee volunteerism and workforce development.

Jane Hyun

Founder and President, Hyun & Associates

Jane Hyun

Founder and President, Hyun & Associates

Jane Hyun is a global leadership strategist and management consultant to Fortune 500 companies, schools, and professional associations. Prior to starting this consulting firm she was Vice President of HR/Talent at JP Morgan, and Director of Recruiting at Deloitte & Touche and Resources Global.

Fields Jackson

CEO, Racing Toward Diversity Magazine

Fields Jackson

CEO, Racing Toward Diversity Magazine

Fields Jackson, Jr. is currently the Founder and CEO of Racing Toward Diversity Magazine, Cary, NC

Charmane Johnson

Director, DoD Policy for Affirmative Employment Programs

Charmane Johnson

Director, DoD Policy for Affirmative Employment Programs

Mrs. Charmane Johnson has more than twenty years’ experience in leading-cutting edge Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) and Diversity programs

AJ Johnson

Actress and Healthy Lifestyle Coach

AJ Johnson

Actress and Healthy Lifestyle Coach

AJ has created a successful online healthy living movement at www.theajzone.com, and has designed wellness platforms for other sites such as Oprah.com, Dailybeast.com and Globalgrind.com

Aparna Khurjekar

Vice President, Verizon Wireless - Network for the South Area

Aparna Khurjekar

Vice President, Verizon Wireless - Network for the South Area

Aparna Khurjekar is Vice President, Verizon Wireless – Network for the South Area. In this role, Aparna is responsible for the wireless network in the South including the build out of the 4G LTE network.

Crystal King

Director, Multicultural Markets, American Heart Association

Crystal King

Director, Multicultural Markets, American Heart Association

Simon T. Bailey is a Leadership Catalyst who aspires to inspire 10% of the world’s population to find their passion and release their brilliance.

Wendy Lewis

Senior Vice President of Diversity & Strategic Alliances, Major League Baseball

Wendy Lewis

Senior Vice President of Diversity & Strategic Alliances, Major League Baseball

Wendy Lewis implements MLB’s Diversity Economic Impact Engagement initiative (DEIE), which is designed to advance the level of MLB’s current workforce and supplier diversity efforts League-wide.

Janice Little

Sr. Director, Diversity & Inclusion, McKesson

Janice Little

Sr. Director, Diversity & Inclusion, McKesson

Janice establishes the strategic direction for diversity initiatives at McKesson. She ensures diversity and inclusion are integrated into McKesson’s business, talent, and culture strategies.

Dr. Annie McKee

Founder of Teleos Leadership Institute

Dr. Annie McKee

Founder of Teleos Leadership Institute

Dr. Annie McKee is Founder of Teleos Leadership Institute, a global leadership and advisory services firm. She also is a Senior Fellow and the Director of the PennCLO Executive Doctoral program at the University of Pennsylvania.

Thomas Murray

Senior Vice President, Chief Talent Officer, EMC

Thomas Murray

Senior Vice President, Chief Talent Officer, EMC

Tom is dedicated to defining EMC as “a people company in the technology business.”

Carmen Ortiz-McGhee

Executive Vice President of Sales, Aon Cornerstone

Carmen Ortiz-McGhee

Executive Vice President of Sales, Aon Cornerstone

Carmen Ortiz-McGhee leads MWBE sourcing and vetting activities throughout the Northeast and Mid-Atlantic regions.

Steve Pemberton

Author and Divisional Vice President and Chief Diversity Officer, Walgreens

Steve Pemberton

Author and Divisional Vice President and Chief Diversity Officer, Walgreens

Steve Pemberton is Divisional Vice-President and Chief Diversity Officer for Walgreens, the first such person to hold that responsibility in the company’s 110 year history.

Nereida Perez

Vice President and Chief Diversity Officer at Ingersoll Rand

Nereida Perez

Vice President and Chief Diversity Officer at Ingersoll Rand

Nereida (Neddy) Perez is an internationally known HR and Diversity practitioner with over 20 years of experience working with Fortune 500 corporations developing diversity & talent development programs as well as corporate social responsibility and employee relations initiatives.

Dr. Rosina L. Racioppi

President and Chief Executive Officer, WOMEN Unlimited, Inc.

Dr. Rosina L. Racioppi

President and Chief Executive Officer, WOMEN Unlimited, Inc.

As President and Chief Executive Officer of WOMEN Unlimited, Inc., Rosina Racioppi spearheads her organization’s initiatives to help Fortune 500 companies cultivate the talent they need for ongoing growth and profitability. Under her leadership, WOMEN Unlimited, Inc.

Sheila Robinson

Diversity Women's Business Leadership (DWBL) Conference Founder, Publisher and CEO of Diversity Woman Magazine

Sheila Robinson

Diversity Women's Business Leadership (DWBL) Conference Founder, Publisher and CEO of Diversity Woman Magazine

Sheila A. Robinson, is the Founder and Publisher of Career Network magazine, a regional publication that provides ideas, solutions and resources to business professionals at all levels.

Dr. Robin Smith

National television personality, best selling author, ordained minister, keynote speaker, and licensed psychologist

Dr. Robin Smith

National television personality, best selling author, ordained minister, keynote speaker, and licensed psychologist

Dr. Robin L. Smith is a national television personality, best selling author, ordained minister, keynote speaker, and licensed psychologist

Carmen Smith

Vice President of Creative Development, Walt Disney Imagineering

Carmen Smith

Vice President of Creative Development, Walt Disney Imagineering

Carmen is responsible for developing a diverse pipeline of product and people to enhance Imagineering’s consultant talent and its creative processes.

Bonnie St. John

Author and Paralympic Medalist

Bonnie St. John

Author and Paralympic Medalist

Bonnie St. John is the author of six books, including her current best seller, How Great Women Lead, which she co-authored with her teenage daughter, Darcy.

Susan Stith

Senior Director of Diversity, Inclusion and Corporate Giving, Express Scripts

Susan Stith

Senior Director of Diversity, Inclusion and Corporate Giving, Express Scripts

Susan A. Stith is the Senior Director of Diversity, Inclusion and Corporate Giving at Express Scripts.

Tyronne Stoudemire

Principal Senior Consultant, Mercer

Tyronne Stoudemire

Principal Senior Consultant, Mercer

Mr. Stoudemire joined Mercer from Aon Hewitt, where he served as the Global Head of Diversity since 2009. A proven thought leader in the space of diversity and inclusion who seeks to enable a transformation of mindset, he is a visionary leader and strategist, certified administrator for the Intercultural Development Inventory (IDI) TM and a certified facilitator in Cultural Transformation Tools TM Tyronne identifies and leverages the opportunities and challenges presented by the expanding multicultural mosaic of worldviews and attitudes regarding health, wealth, and performance given the increasing diversity in the workplace and global marketplace.

Anise D. Wiley-Little

Nika Williams

Actress, Producer, Comedian

Nika Williams

Actress, Producer, Comedian

Nika is often called The Black Lucille Ball. Like Lucy, she started her career as a fashion model, but soon realized she’d rather make a silly face than strike a pose.

Jacklyn Mitchell Wynn

Anna Zornosa

CEO and Founder, RubyRibbon Inc

CEO and Founder, RubyRibbon Inc

nna Zornosa’s career has included leadership positions at start-ups as well as large public companies. She founded Ruby Ribbon in September 2011 as an apparel company whose unique products are available only through social commerce.
